name: op2nda

body.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c1)
-| wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), cuni(csn(c1)))
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c1)), c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c1)
-| wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), cuni(csn(c1)))
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c1)), c1)

body.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), cuni(csn(c1)))
-| wceq(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c1)
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c1)), c1)
-| wceq(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c1))

|- wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c1)
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c1)), c1)
-| wcel(c0, universe)

|- wceq(cuni(crn(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c1)
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wcel(c1, universe)

comment: Extract the second member of an ordered pair. (See ~ op1sta to extract the first member, ~ op2ndb for an alternate version, and ~ op2nd for the preferred version.) (Contributed by NM, 17-Feb-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 27-Aug-2011.)
